metadata.title: CVE-2021-3752 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s Bluetooth subsystemin the way user calls connect to the socket and disconnect simultaneouslydue to a race condition. This flaw allows a user to crash the system orescalate their privileges. The highest threat from this vulnerability is toconfidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.15.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-25.25').
